text: Finsbury Park TMD was a railway Traction Maintenance Depot situated in London, England. It was the first purpose built main line diesel locomotive depot opened in England and it was fully commissioned in April 1960.Baker, p 23 Finsbury Park was a steam shed under British Railways with the depot code 34G; the depot code of the diesel depot under BR was FP. The nearest railway station is Finsbury Park. The maintenance shed held six roads. Roads seven to eleven were located to the east, with number ten road also accommodating the breakdown train shed. Additionally there were five roads of stabling in Clarence Yard, which was nearest to the main running lines. The depot was downgraded in June 1981 and closed in October 1983.Baker, p 97 The site is now covered in residential flats which can be seen to the south-west of Finsbury Park station. ==The Deltics== Following the closure of Kings Cross Top Shed and the withdrawal of steam locomotives, much of the traction power for express passenger workings on the East Coast Main Line was taken over by Class 55 Deltic diesel locomotives. Those allocated to Finsbury Park were named after famous racehorses, whilst those allocated to Haymarket TMD and Gateshead TMD were named after British Army regiments. ===Finsbury Park's Deltics === {|cellpadding="2" | {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Original Number !TOPS number !Name !Withdrawn !Status |- |align=center|D9001 |align=center|55 001 |St. Paddy | |Scrapped BREL Doncaster February 1980. |- |align=center|D9003 |align=center|55 003 |Meld | |Scrapped BREL Doncaster March 1981. |- |align=center|D9007 |align=center|55 007 |Pinza | |Scrapped BREL Doncaster August 1982. |- |align=center|D9009 |align=center|55 009 |Alycidon | |Preserved - Mainline Registered |- |align=center|D9012 |align=center|55 012 |Crepello | |Scrapped BREL Doncaster September 1981. |- |align=center|D9015 |align=center|55 015 |Tulyar | |Preserved |- |align=center|D9018 |align=center|55 018 |Ballymoss | |Scrapped BREL Doncaster January 1982. |- |align=center|D9020 |align=center|55 020 |Nimbus | |Scrapped BREL Doncaster January 1980. Rumours persist that Nimbus was not scrapped and was sighted intact afterwards. However there are also photographs of it already dismantled, as officially claimed. |} |} ==References== * * * ==Further reading== * Category:Railway depots in London Category:Buildings and structures in the London Borough of Islington
title: Finsbury Park TMD
